channel.title: FU Jagex: NuBia Re-designed [Reason inside]
channel.description:
OK, so the day that i made the NuBia account is the exact day my account got shut down. They mistaken me for phishing Runescape accounts when I clearly wasn't. It's common sense that the site doesn't look exactly like the Runescape site anyways. When I tried to respond to them they immediately closed my account the second I sent them a ticket. Moments later I got a response from them but was not able to read it because my account had become suspended though! So... I got rid of the original NuBia template and went into designing madness, I could not think of any design that would perfectly fit the Runescape theme, so now I'm like fuck it and just put basic stuff down:
[u][b]Home ::[/b][/u] 1 - http://i44.tinypic.com/2dkd8it.png
[u][b]Register ::[/b][/u] 1 - http://i41.tinypic.com/xo4mbn.png 2 - http://i40.tinypic.com/50o1ty.png 3 - http://i42.tinypic.com/wjhtnp.png
A special thanks to the moron who reported my site, hater you suck in real life nerd.

item.title: FU Jagex: NuBia Re-designed [Reason inside]
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:6, topic:286518”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=378922.msg2850193#msg2850193 date=1246493363]
Is there a program that allows you to actually draw a website lay out and convert it to markup?
[/quote]
No.
Real web developers slice up the template in photoshop, then write the markup and CSS by hand, so it is optimized and semantic.[/quote]

Fireworks <3, If you use it properly, you don’t have to hand code anything. Except maybe the CSS… unless they’ve covered that in the newer versions.

Read full topic

item.title: FU Jagex: NuBia Re-designed [Reason inside]
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:21, topic:286518”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=378922.msg2850238#msg2850238 date=1246495122]

Is there a program that allows you to actually draw a website lay out and convert it to markup?

No.
Real web developers slice up the template in photoshop, then write the markup and CSS by hand, so it is optimized and semantic.
[/quote]
No.
Real web developers just make the images in photoshop, they don’t create a picture first then slice it up.[/quote]

There’s no set rules for Web Development. Many people have different ways of doing. Even though some of them are wrong. You can’t say what a real web developer does to get to the end result. Because real web developers do it many different ways.

Read full topic

item.title: FU Jagex: NuBia Re-designed [Reason inside]
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:17, topic:286518”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=378922.msg2854947#msg2854947 date=1246773520]

Making a template in photoshop and slicing it up is bad, because, in the end, you end up with way too many images, and you won’t get the actual look you want.

Then you’re doing it wrong. Of course you don’t slice it up into parts and stick them back together on the website; the PSD gives you a guideline to the design - you only use images when they’re necessary and you make optimizations such as using 1px wide image gradients.

Yes, I know, I just prefer not to slice it up in Photoshop. I just make the design layout in divs without colors, then I add borders, etc.

I just make my websites different, in other words, and I don’t like slicing in Photoshop.
[/quote]

Because you’re incompetent?[/quote]
No, I make decent websites, I just don’t like slicing in Photoshop. Not all website designers have to make their design in photoshop and slice it. I just have a rather different website making method.

I prefer to make the buttons, navagation menus, banners, etc, separately.

Read full topic

I just make my websites different, in other words, and I don’t like slicing in Photoshop.[/quote]

Because you’re incompetent?

item.title: FU Jagex: NuBia Re-designed [Reason inside]
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

Server-Unknown.Net:

You can design a website without a tablet, but a wocom tablet lets you become more creative with strokes.

How does web design sketching with such a tablet induce more creativity?
I’d be interested in knowing since I think it’s pretty annoying to draw a sketch of a website with a wacom tablet. I love my pencil and paper - it enables me to sketch and erase anything I want: quickly and with ease.

Read full topic

So I really don’t suck, and I am a web designer, but I can spread my ability if I get photoshop acting correctly - which for some odd reasons will not act right at all.

I have made postes about how to get photoshop loading bar thing acting right but no one is able to help me.
